title: Rain fly will fail after minimal use
author: Kira Beckham
comments: Bought this tent to shave weight off my pack.  I take immaculate care of my gear.  After 4 or 5 uses the rainfly started getting sticky.  It turns out my rain fly protected tant completely failed and now I've got a useless tent.  In effect I paid $100 per night for this rent.  Worse Cascade Designs/MSR admitted it is a known product failure but won't replace the fly.  They will only sell me a replacement for $120.  Loved the tent initially but it's useless in Colorado without the fly!  Don't buy it! ALSO, hummingbirds are killed when they are attracted to the red tent and get caught in the mesh.  I advised them if this issue also yet it is still red!

title: Good all around 2-person backpacking tent!
author: Fredonyer it is!
comments: I have two of these tents, and have used them for backpacking in Sierra's, Teton's, and Glacier NP...  Total use is probably 30+ nights, and they are still holding up well.  Mostly fair weather, but I did have a couple rain events.  They are easy to set up (even the deer in the pic shown can do it!), and with some added thought (beyond a deer's skill level), they can be set up in rain to minimize inside wetness.  They aren't the lightest option, but I think they offer a good balance of weight/durability/price (I initially had a little sticker shock, but after 30 uses with no issue, the shock goes away :) ).  I highly recommend!  Note:  The deer in the pic was seeking trekking poles, and soon after pic was taken, scored one from a backpacking neighbor...  Funny stuff!  My 12/13 yo daughters actually set up that tent.  Taken in Glacier, Head of Glenn Lake.

title: Five Stars
author: RT
comments: Great quality. Stable in high winds.

title: Weird odor
author: Vladimir
comments: My tent has an unpleasant odor that resembles sulfur. I went to local shop and the same model there had no smell at all, some friends reported that their tents had the same smell as mine. So, if you are sensitive to odors, I'd recommend to buy it in person after the odor check.I left my tent open on the balcony for 3 weeks and it got a little better. Hope it will go away eventually.Other then this problem tent is quite spacious and light, and very fast to setup.

title: Well built, lightweight, comfortable
author: erwin t.
comments: I went from a Snugpak Ionosphere "bivey" style tent to this tent and I am loving the Hubba Hubba!  My bivey was lightweight but like a coffin.  I spent two nights in this new tent last weekend. It was very easy to set up and with an amazingly roomy compression bag it was just as easy to pack up.

title: Don’t waste your money on this tent
author: Jeremiah
comments: After 20 days of use this tent developed several holes in the mesh.  Sent back to the manufacturer for repairs and was charged $50 for the the repair.  This tent was a complete waste of money.

title: Overall very disappointed in what I thought was a reliable tent and ...
author: Michael Dore
comments: Pole broke on the first step up (in my living room). I contacted the warranty department and two weeks later a back and forth ensued. 6 weeks later I had a replacement piece for the broke pole but no new string. Overall very disappointed in what I thought was a reliable tent and even more disappointed in the customer service. I have purchased a different tent as I just do not trust the construction of this tent.

title: This tent was easy to carry
author: Sarah
comments: I just used this in Maine the end of April. For anyone who knows, that means any kind of weather possible. In 26 hours we had 60 and sunny, then rain, then sleet and snow, then rain while setting up, and 20’s that night. Foggy and damp breaking down the next am. This tent was easy to carry, quick to set up and break down (even in a snow bed). Most of all, it kept me and the pooch warm and dry. I did get some condensation overnight, but I didn’t open the vents because I wanted to keep heat in. Wasn’t too bad though, only around where I slept. Seeing as I didn’t put a footprint down and was on snow, I thought it did great!  Now that I know this can handle itself in weird spring weather, I look forward to using it this summer while peak bagging!

title: Four Stars
author: Bloomingstar
comments: Feel spacious inside and built very well. But mine came with several damages on the net.

title: Tent pole broken, don't buy this tent
author: Rob Blakers
comments: I bought this tent just a couple of years ago and it has had only light and occasional use. It has not been in high winds. Despite that, one tent pole has split, endangering the tent fabric and rendering the tent unusable. This is an unreliable and dangerous tent. My email to Cascade designs is unanswered after 2 weeks, and an expensive overseas phone call was similarly unanswered.

title: Degradation of material (short product life)
author: Amazon Customer
comments: I had a BRAND NEW Hubba Hubba NX 2 person + Gear Shield which were bought online around two years ago. NEVER USE. Was found the fly and interior start degradation as the surface was sticky and could not be use. Very frustrated.Moreover, there's also a beloved Carbon Reflex 3p which was a gift from friend couple years ago. Was found even worse in condition. The tent was used ONCE before but found all the coating became some kind of plastic flakes last week as well.Local distributor was contacted but I was told nothing to do but dump it all as I couldn't show the receipt.Really angry with these.MSR used to be one of the best and my favorite brand for outdoor equipment as for its reliability. Sometimes relatively expensive but in the wild, safety always comes first. If you have any other suggestion from dumping those tents, please speak out. As that would be a wastage to myself and our environment.

title: IMPLODES IN HEAVY WINDS I loved this tent when using it in ideal spring and ...
author: bikergal
comments: IMPLODES IN HEAVY WINDS  I loved this tent when using it in ideal spring and summer weather.  It's lightweight, fits easily in my backpack, fast to pitch.  However, the 4th time I used it, less than 2 years after purchase, it was a TOTAL FAIL during heavy winds at Joshua Tree.  The main tent pole snapped and the rain fly ripped.  We had to abandon the tent and hightail to our car at midnight when the tent collapsed onto us.  Meanwhile, the cheapo Coleman tent next to us was still standing tall.I expect much more from a $400 tent!!!  I've contacted MSR re replacing the poles and fly (on their dime!) and am waiting for a reply.  I'll update this post if they honor the MSR reputation and replace those parts.bottom line:  I highly do NOT recommend using this tent in high winds!

title: Five Stars
author: Maria del Pilar Garcia
comments: Great tent, there is tone of space inside, everything as promised from the manufacturer...

title: This tent is seriously amazing!!
author: Deborah H.
comments: This tent is seriously amazing!!!I am in Hawaii, near the jungle and it has been torrentially downpouring for over a week. All my fellow campers are having major issues. I am still dry in my awesome lil tent.

title: The best available to suit my requirements
author: Marc S.
comments: The best available to suit my requirements. So many great features and nothing that I don't like as yet.

title: Light and well made, simple to setup.
author: Ricky@AWS
comments: I used this a couple of weeks ago in the hight of summer in New Zealand.  It was light, fast to setup, and kept us cool and safe from the multitude of sandflys trying to get to us. I like this tent as a light option to take tramping even if we are planning to sleep in huts.  With the openness of the tent, it really suits 3 of New Zealand's seasons and even maybe winter in lower and warmer areas.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Lightweight got most credit on this item.

title: Good tent for good weather, not so good tent for bad weather, but bearable. Slightly overpriced.
author: Andrey Streltsov
comments: Stands poorly in rain and wind conditions. The outer tent doesn't go down to the ground, which allow wind to go freely to the inner tent. If it is cold outside, you'll feel it very well. If the wind is strong then outer tent will be pressed on to the inner, and condensate will leak trough the mesh. You can do basically nothing against it.If you put the tent somewhere not at campground, then there is maybe a little slope. With that given tent is stretching weirdly sometimes, but usually it is okay. It has very convenient system of tensing straps - 5 stars for it.Insects like mesh material by some reason. We've got few holes made by ants :-)And the worst is that outer tent has started leaking. We were using tent heavily, almost every day or every other day, for past 6-7 months. There wasn't much raining, as well as much sun(because it was used in the evening-night-morning time, to sleep), but now it leaks from the points near of where zipper begins, on the top. Also water tends to drop from the top arch pole. Probably it is coming from seams.Bottom footprint is a must have for real word usage(rocky ground, mud, etc).I like the white color of the tent, it makes very nice and bright lightning inside. However there is also green version(I think it is available Europe only, but unsure) which will work better for hiding :)

title: value
author: Ron Riley
comments: nice tent for 3 years then holes appeared in the netting (not from zipper snags, small animals or any other accident). moderate use each year. warranty limited to 3 years so I'm on my own for repairs. expensive tent for only 3 years of wear.

title: Recommend
author: UsrNmeHere
comments: Great bag design makes setting up and breaking down easier and faster.  Roomy for a small 2 person without a foot taper which helps fit larger pads inside pretty well.  Dual vestibules are just big enough for a pack and other gear.

title: Easy lightweight set up
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Love the this tent, used on A 5 day backpacking trip and worked out great l

title: Super tent. Easy to put up
author: rg1
comments: Super tent. Easy to put up. Lightweight. Plenty of room for 2 but for one you have room for all your gear inside.

title: The best tent I've ever owned!
author: Destructo
comments: I've previously owned the REI Half Dome 2 and bought this tent as a replacement because I thought it would be comparable. I was wrong. This tent is so far superior to the Half Dome 2 in every way. It's MUCH lighter, packs down much smaller, easier to set up, seems roomier and the build quality and materials seem so much better. If you're trying to decide whether to buy the Half Dome 2 or to spend the extra and buy the Hubba Hubba, I'd recommend the Hubba Hubba every time. You're be a lot happier in the long run.

title: Awesome tent. Perfect for 1-man
author: Prill Lake
comments: Awesome tent.  Perfect for 1-man, 3-season adventures where you are concerned about weight.  A bit cramped for two people unless its one adult and one child.  Easily packs up into a small 6" x 14" duffel.  Rain resistant,, tough to beat for lightweight adventure.

title: Won't be buying anything from MSR anymore
author: MarkL.
comments: I've owned the previous version of this tent for seven years now.  It has been used 1-2 times per year during that time.  I've stored it loosely, and have always hung it to dry outside before storing.  The waterproof coating has completely deteriorated, turning into a sticky mess, and MSR refuses to stand behind the product.  This would be understandable if it hadn't happened before, but this is a known issue that they have openly acknowledged on multiple backpacking forums.  I have other tents that are 20+ years old, with no such issues.  Great tents if you want to spend premium money on a disposable product.  In the future, I'll instead support a company that stands behind their products.  Proceed with caution.

title: Awesome tent.
author: Dan S.
comments: I have used this tent several times now and it is great. Easy to set up and high quality. The last time the wind was blowing so hard that others were having a hard time even setting up.  Since you first stake it down and only then raise it, I had no problems.  Held up great in the wind.

title: HH
author: B Keith
comments: I've used this on several trips in varied conditions and I like it a lot. Not the lightest tent out there but it is a good compromise giving me the space I need for two people and keeps me warm and dry.

title: Five Stars
author: Antony
comments: I love it, thanks.

title: The vents on each side are a great touch because they keep the tent from getting nasty ...
author: Sawyer Burnett
comments: The tent took a while to get used to, but I now can put it up very quickly. It has been through multiple monsoons in Arizona with me as well as very hot weather. The vents on each side are a great touch because they keep the tent from getting nasty and muggy at night.  Pairing this along with the footprint and the tent looks like it will stay good for a long while!

title: 1st use feedback
author: Ruichun Duan
comments: Used only once at mountain area in good weather night. Everything is good. Except that the size of the tent is larger than I imaged.

title: Use this on a four-day backpacking trip in the Adirondack ...
author: Kurt W Pfaffenbach
comments: Use this on a four-day backpacking trip in the Adirondack high peaks. Room for two people as long as packs are left outside. Well ventilated With no condensation on the inside in the morning.

title: Recommended by a friend who has one and camps in ...
author: tonestar
comments: Recommended by a friend who has one and camps in all 4 seasons and so far it's been fantastic!  Setup takes a couple of minutes, super lightweight, poles are well built and the intuitive vent design is smart.  It's gonna work great in the snow providing it's not blizzard conditions :)

title: I love this tent
author: ADV Nevada
comments: I love this tent, by far the best tent I have owned yet. Very easy to set up, and feels solid in the wind. The quality is awesome, yet it is lightweight. Fits great in my saddle bag as long as I put the poles with my chair. I highly recommend this tent. Great for ADV motorcycles. MSR Hubba Hubba NX Tent, Red

title: Works great!
author: Kenneth McLeod
comments: Excellent product.

title: I do say it made the camping trip a fun experience.
author: The Hand
comments: A heavy thunderstorm swept through the Texas Hill Country on my first time out with this tent. My wife and I stayed dry, fast setup and take down.I do say it made the camping trip a fun experience.

title: Best tent I have owned.  Water tight!!!
author: tom mcneeley
comments: Awesome lightweight tent.  Just took it on a 3 night trip in Mammoth Cave NP (27 miles).  It rained a lot, and I stayed dry, and that is the paramount feature of any tent.  Add in that this goes up in a flash (helpful during a downpour), has quality construction and stitching, and is under four pounds, makes this tent hard to beat.  Large vestibule on either side give ample space to store two packs and boots.  Interior space is great for 1 person, but you could squeeze 2 in there.  Dimensions are a little smaller than advertised.  Chose this over the Copper Spur and Quarter Dome due to its beefier fabrics, although slightly heavier.  Glad i did, as i poked the fly with one of the poles pretty good in a scramble to get it up in the rain, but no damage!!  Not a fan of fragility in the outdoors where "things happen."  Best tent I have owned hands down.Update:  Still the best tent I have owned.  I have used this now on two backpacking trips, one in Colorado and one in Kentucky.  Both times we ran into storms and it kept us and our gear dry!  Super easy to set up, break down, and the stuff sack is great (immensely important after a long day on the trail).  Also this tent will fit two adults.  My friend and I (both around 6 feet and 230 lbs) Confirmed this on our recent trip to Colorado in high altitude, where we wanted to spit the weight of one tent instead of two.  It's tight, but doable.  Also, condensation is just something that every tent is going to have, especially with two people in this tent.  If you are expecting not to have any (very small amount in this tent as I have experienced) well good luck to you!!!

title: light tent but not easy to set up when raining or windy
author: Amazon Customer
comments: light tent but not easy to set up when raining or windy!The space is very tight for 2 persons but that's the condition for the lightweight!I would advise to consider the Tent Nordisk Halland 2 LW for serious hiking weather condition but the price is higher but justified i guess!

title: Wouldn't change a thing
author: Tanner D
comments: Unbelievable tent. I was worried going the full tent route, as I prefer to be as lightweight as possible, and this tent fits my style perfectly. Extremely light and compact when packed. Setup takes literally 1 or 2 minutes. I am 6' tall and easily fit myself and all of my gear inside. I wouldn't change a thing about the tent. Comes with MSR stakes but no footprint.

title: Fantastic hiking tent
author: Denis
comments: I bought this tent for lightweight backpacking along the Appalachian trail. It sets up easily and provides a surprising amount of space, enough for 2 people and their gear to sleep comfortably. It is water resistant and kept me dry in the rain. Tear down is very easy, all the poles collapse down together, and theres no special tricks required to get it back into its carry bag. It is the best investment I have made for backpacking.

title: Grate tent
author: Sergii
comments: First using was grate with strong wind

title: very quick and easy to put up and take down
author: Jason Sampsell
comments: I used this tent on a recent 70+ mile hike through the Ocala National forest. Prior to using it, i practiced putting it up twice in my yard, so I would have no issues in the woods in case of a rain storm or having to put it up in the dark. The tent only weighs slightly over 4 lbs, very quick and easy to put up and take down. I have the footprint that goes with it, almost weightless, all fits in the red carry case. It attached  easily to my pack and has more than enough space for me and my gear. I have not used it as a two person tent, but would imagine it would provide enough space for two people. I believe it was a good purchase!

title: This is an awesome tent at a great price
author: Jay
comments: This is an awesome tent at a great price. I have used it on two long distance hikes throughout New Mexico and Texas. It is super lightweight, durable, easy to set up, and pretty fool proof. I love how the directions are printed right on the top flap of the carrying bag. I would recommend setting this up at home to practice before you head out because the rain fly is a bit tricky the first time with the inner poles. Love this tent and is now my new go to tent for lightweight backpacking. Buy this tent. You will not be disappointed.

title: Home away from home.
author: Eric P.
comments: Spacious for one person.  Easy setup.  This tent came with 10 MSR Needle stakes.  Not the lightest tent, but seems more durable than others for the terrain I plan on using it in.

title: Great...
author: Thomas A. Farmer
comments: What can you say it's nothing but a very well made tent and worth the money.

title: Good tent
author: Bryan
comments: I recently purchased a MSR hubba hubba nx2 for long term usage. I live in California and the weather tends to be generally warm. I used it on an overnight lake camping trip in the 30's and the tent did great. I did notice that the inner part of the tent condensated a lot but then I opened up the sides and it made it ventilate a lot better. I love how light weight it is and It's perfect for two people, even though I bought it with the intention of using it for one. Lots of space, two doors, 2 ceiling loops to hang tent lights in, good quality material, lightweight, and freestanding. The price is a little too much in my opinion, but I bought it because I knew it would last me a long time.

title: GREAT TENT
author: Scott Chapman
comments: Fantastic tent!  Easy to put up, plenty of room.  Exactly as described, shipped and received within the published time.  Would definitely buy again.

title: Four Stars
author: John Dwyer
comments: Got it from REI but a great tent

title: Bad condensation due to ventialoation
author: Angela J. Toms
comments: This tent has a serious problem with condensation. We were soaking wet, on 3 nights that we spent in this tent with the rain fly on. Ventilation is just not good

title: Five Stars
author: Manuel
comments: awesome quality

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It is great

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: As good as everyone, literally everyone, says.

title: Five Stars
author: Judith Engle
comments: High quality

title: 5/5 This is a great light weight 3 season tent
author: T Yu
comments: 4.5/5This is a great light weight 3 season tent.Pros1. Good ventilation2. Two doors/vestibules with good space so a pack can be stored on either side3. Very easy set up. One person could do it alone in 5 minutes after doing it a few times. Would recommend setting the tent up at home to try out before going on a trip.4. Weight: pretty lightCons1. Does not include footprint2. Could have more internal pockets

title: Five Stars
author: Tosihiro NAKAI
comments: VERY GOOD

title: Superior tent - Can't be happier.
author: IL_Lax_Daddy
comments: This is a superior tent.Things I Like:-Light, really light for all the room.  Packs small too.-Roomy: I can sit-up and not have my head hit the fly and my feet/head don't hit the ends either.  I'm 6'2" and it is long enough and tall enough.  I use it primarily as a 1-person tent, but it can fit 2-real adults if you want/need to.-Easy Setup:  Love that the fly and tent have color matching tabs.  How many times have you had to spin your fly around trying to figure out which end is which with other tents?  Easy as pie here.-Warm and Cool:  I've been cozy in sub-freezing and cool in hot weather.  The fly gives you lots of options.  I've not used the fly and footprint alone yet, but I've set it up that way and it's easy.  I've just been chicken to pack only the fly and footprint.-I love the Mudmats.  They tie into the corners of the tent with margin under it and keep the vestibule clean.  Makes entering the tent on your knees a dry/clean event.  Keeps pack out of the muck on rainy days.  Highly recommended.-Yup.  It looks cool in person too.-Durable so far.  Yes these are lightweight fabrics, but if you take care of them....Things I don't like:Nothing.  It is expensive, but you get what you pay for.  This is a superior tent that doesn't require trade-offs.Summary - this is the 4th tent in my stable and definitely my favorite  I have a 1-man that isn't free-standing.  Yes it's light and packs in a gnat's bum, but I have to shelter my pack somewhere else and it doesn't have much more room than my sleeping bag.  I have a 3-man that has been everywhere. It's a wonderful 2-person tent, but my son uses that all the time.  It is looking for it's second trip to Philmont in 2018. I also have an old Eureka Octagon 11.  Super car camping tent if you have a bunch of folks, but that's not a useful comparison.

title: I Love my tent
author: rosie Gabrielle
comments: I Love my tent.  its super light, quick to put up and perfect size for me and my gear.  It would be too squishy for two people and gear though.

title: Five Stars
author: joe
comments: Excelent

title: BEST TENT EVER!!!!
author: R. Kov.
comments: BEST TENT EVER!!!!

title: Loving it
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Loving it - finally gave my long suffering Macpac Minaret a break. Problem so far is getting to use it as its snaffled by the rest of the family and I get the tarp-tent.Just the attention to design detail is a beautiful thing.Hope it last as long as the Minaret

title: Awesome backpacking tent
author: holly huff
comments: Can't say enough good things about this tent. I had the MSR Elixir 3, for car camping, before this one. I wanted to go lighter weight and I'm so glad I did! Packs well, easy to set up, comfortable layout, excellent ventilation. I do recommend using a footprint, as the materials are lighter weight and slightly less durable. You can make your own or shell out $$ for MSR's specific one with grommets. They really don't include any accessories with this model. Guy out points were sufficient for my purposes. It could fit 2 people tightly (lager packs would probably need to stay in the vestibules, and no luxury width sleeping pads). I just used it solo in the Sierra/Yosemite and loved having that space to keep my gear inside and out of the dust. Temps fluctuated between 38F at night and 75F during day, didn't experience any condensation with vestibules closed and vents opened. Haven't had the opportunity to test it with precipitation, though. For the backpacker who isn't ready to go truly ultralight, this is a brilliant choice.

title: Of the highest quality, but the similar can be done spending much less
author: scooterdavis
comments: This tent is very light, yet constructed of quality materials. It's light enough for solo trips should you want a little more room, but not light enough for the ultralighters. It leaves a small footprint; which is handy if real estate is a concern. (Also, I would use some sort of ground-cloth to protect it's bottom). Both the tent body and rainfly are freestanding, giving you additional options. This tent is super easy to set up, but the way the doors open is a little different from what I'm used too. Instead of unzipping straight out, perpendicular to the tent body, they zip/unzip along the tent body; if that makes sense. So, the doors unzip differently, depending on how you place the rainfly. The poles are great, lightweight aluminum and linked together, and this tent comes with Groundhog stakes. (Tough to get out of rocky soil, but that's a good thing isn't it?). One con: The price. This is a very nice tent, and I would recommend it/buy it again, but it isn't cheap. You can do just as much spending much less, but you're not going to do it with this light, or with this much style! Used so far for 5 nights in Olympic National Park last August. Many, many more uses to come!

title: Awesome so far
author: Amazon Customer
comments: It's an engineering marvel.

title: READ THIS AND THEN BUY THIS TENT ASAP!!!
author: Chad Matejcek
comments: Wow I freaking love this tent. MSR absolutely killed it!!! I've had my Hubba Hubba since 2006 (10 years now) and it is still in fantastic condition. I recommend buying the footprint for an extra $45 or whatever it costs now. This thing keeps every single drop of water out during storms. I've even pitched it in snow, which melted into a giant 5 inch deep puddle by morning - I was on my sleeping pad, but when I felt the tent flow with my hand, it felt like a water bed... not a drop inside the tent. The seams are incredible. It's lightweight. I have the yellow rainfly, but on the inside in the sun it's almost white. 2 hooks to hang lanterns on the inside. Large enough vestibules for large 60-80mliter packs, campstove, and shoes. Also extra loops on the inside where you can hang chord if you need to dry clothing or gear in the rain. Use the poles with the tent, tent and fly, or just fly alone if you're a weight weenie. 2 people can sit up comfortably on their inflated sleeping pads with room t spare for their heads. I've pitched this tent in storms, and it sets up in less than 5 minutes. I love this tent. It has stood the test of time. I've never had a cracked or bent pole, and man I've been drunk sometimes while pitching this thing at festivals or phish shows. My ONLY wish is that the rain fly had some sort of window, but you have to sacrifice some things to get an ultralight tent. So durable. Hold up during massive storms. I actually really enjoy being in my Hubba Hubba during storms, because you're so comfortable. Doesn't get too humid or anything. Doesn't blow around. And again you stay dry. Guy-out points on the outside keep it on the ground, during the windiest of days. Best damn 2 person tent ever. Spend the extra money for the footprint (that goes under your tent floor) and it'll last forever. Buy this thing. Now.

title: Great, compact tent
author: Mark
comments: Great tent. Packs up compact for motorcycle camping.

title: Hubba Hubba Do
author: Lincoln Colcord
comments: Very well engineered, very light. Lightness requires some care with zippers, etc. but the light components together make a strong structure. No extra room inside with 2 people, but not cramped. Quick to set up.

title: I love this tent
author: Jimmy Swanbeck
comments: I love this tent!! I used a family member's Hubba for a section on the Appalachian Trail last year and decided I loved the design enough to splurge on a Hubba Hubba. It's definitely worth the (minimal) extra weight for the 2 person version even if you're solo hiking, I feel like there was just the right amount of room for me and my pack/gear to fit comfortably, and I've heard thru hikers say they wished they had the extra space. It's ridiculously easy and fast to set up since there's only the one pole, and when packing it up you stuff it in its bag sideways, so you don't need to spend ages trying to roll it up tight enough to fit in lengthwise. It's < 5 min set-up/take-down when you get into the routine.

title: Five Stars
author: Pen
comments: Absolutely love this tent!! So easy to put up and take down.

title: Felt like plenty of room for two
author: Swedishish chef
comments: Felt like plenty of room for two. Very happy with the weight and volume. A little odd that the outer tent is so close to the inner tent at the short sides. No problem for a single person to set it up.

title: good quality, simple setup
author: jackson cj
comments: Light weight, good quality, simple setup, the internal space of the tent is large, with 10 to nail, collapsed after the volume is small, it is very convenient to carry.Worth buying a tent.

title: Great for backpacking
author: Krisbhappy
comments: Easy to pitch, roomy, light weight and packs well.  Backpacked with it last weekend and have nothing but good things to say.  Would be 5 stars were it not for the price which is a bit on the high  side.

title: MSR makes amazing gear.
author: Austin McDaniel
comments: Msr hubba hubba is a steal for anything less then 300. It has been on my back and I have never been upset with the size weight or quality. MSR makes amazing gear.

title: I love this tent
author: Aristat
comments: Lightweight, reliable, and spacious. Great tent overall!

title: Great Tent
author: Cameron
comments: Great tent.  Lighter than my Eureka 1-person and packs down smaller.  First trip I took it on it rained the entire night and no water got in the tent, even without a footprint.  Also had great ventilation, felt a nice cool breeze every time the wind blew.  Definitely worth the money.

title: Fast, light, intuitive!
author: Michael D Ames
comments: Bought this tent on a whim at the recommendation of my best friend. Set it up for the first time on a very windy Alaska alpine ridge at 10:00pm after a long day of hiking. Very intuitive setup! The rain fly is color coded so you always put it on right. Every single pole is connected together! No fumbling around trying to remember which pole goes where. The entire tent pole system is connected with elastic shock cord. I did not know this going in to the setup, and was very pleasantly surprised. My first night was very windy and I had to run a few guy lines (included) to prevent flapping of the rain fly. The second night was deathly still, not a breath of wind, and very muggy, but still zero condensation inside the tent or fly. I highly recommend this tent!

title: Was easy to put up by yourself and the zipper nevr ...
author: Matthew Moore
comments: Was easy to put up by yourself and the zipper nevr got stuck. Never got rained on yet, so don't know how waterproof it is. Overall great tent and is light compared to others.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: love this tent.  It is easy to put up.  Plenty of room for two people.  Light for backpacking.

title: Five Stars
author: David W Bowden
comments: Awesome!

title: Terrific thru-hike shelter
author: Adam E
comments: I'm absolutely loving this tent.  While it is heavier than some other models I was considering purchasing (Tarptent, Big Agnes, etc), this model had the features that my wife and I were looking for as our new thru-hike backpacking shelter.A true rectangle, you get a floorplan that doesn't taper at the feet end.  This means you can fit 2 adults shoulder to shoulder and still fit.  Who wants to sleep with their face by someone else's feet after days of hiking?  I sure don't.The mesh tent body construction breathes very well, pretty much eliminating condensation.  The rainfly also breathes extremely well, allowing just enough airflow through to keep condensation down considerably while still keeping you warm inside.  The fly also has an extra optional vent on each end to allow even more airflow on those warmer nights, and these vents can also be closed with velcro.The tent is extremely secure even in high winds.  The simple setup process, including full tent, rainfly, and footprint, means you can get out of the weather very quickly.The vestibules provide ample space for a pack and pair of shoes on each side, and it also allows each occupant to have their own entry/exit point.  Critical when you need to keep gear dry, but when you also need to get in/out for those nighttime bio breaks.I'm 6'1" and 230 lbs, and I fit great in this tent.  My wife is much smaller than me, so we fit just fine side by side and have plenty of foot room inside, and head space for our stuff sack pillows.  The cross beam on the top pole keeps the side walls away from you, making the tent walls vertical all around you.  2 storage netting shelves built into the tent provide more than enough overhead/over-foot storage for multiple items such as our headlamps, both phones, charger battery, and some other small items.With 2 people, we had this tent set up, without instructions, in 7 minutes.  On the second test, I assembled it solo and had it fully up in 6 minutes without help.  Takedown was even faster, which is always a plus when you're up before the sun and want to get back on the trail quickly.The fabric is thin on this tent (tent body consists of 2 densities of mesh, basically.  The floor is then tent material, so spend the extra $49 and get the optional footprint.  I can't overstate that enough.  This tent, including stuff sack, poles, stakes, and footprint, pack up very easily into the included top-loading compression sack and it packs small enough to easily fit inside of your pack with room for all other necessary gear.  It also straps very easily to the outside of your pack, and packs short enough to not stick out past the sides of your pack.Total weight with stuff sack, tent body, rainfly, footprint, tent pole set, and all 10 ground stakes came out to 4.07lbs on my digital scale.  Again, a little heavier than some, but lighter than many.  4 lbs truly is not bad at all for having everything you need for a full setup.

title: Great tent, bad product name.
author: Host
comments: Awesome little tent.  I'm only going to to ding it for the terrible product naming.  While searching for information on this, and then the appropriate footprint, I kept getting confused between the single person Hubba, and this 2-person Hubba Hubba...

title: Five Stars
author: Rb
comments: The best tent.

title: The 5-Star Ratings are Justified - This Tent is No Joke - You Won't be Disappointed
author: WATCHER
comments: I love this tent.  Here's why:1)  It's light and very compact.  The compression bag is a great addition.2)  The freestanding unified pole system is light, strong, and takes seconds to configure.3)  The ventilation is awesome which will reduce or even eliminate condensation.4)  With our without the MSR Hubba Hubba NX-2 footprint (not included), the assembly of the tent is intuitive and easy with only one person.6)  It's very spacious for one person and will fit two average size people with no problem.  Don't expect to put two NFL linebackers in this thing.7)  I spent ~6 months researching new tents and I kept returning to this tent due to the best bang for the buck.  At approximately three hundred dollars, this tent is a great buy.NOTE:  The tent included stakes but they were basic and not as aggressive as the MSR Groundhog stakes.  Again, the tent did not include the MSR Groundhog or Mini-Groundhog stakes.My Overall rating:  Stars 5+ (I was not paid for this review.)

title: Love it
author: Amazon Customer
comments: My first backpacking tent and I love it, was very easy to setup and disassemble. I'm 5'7" and its perfect for me.

title: Five Stars
author: jim vedda
comments: Nice tent. Very easy to set up and break down. Good quality and well thought out.

title: The Hubba Hubba tent is extremely easy to set up and it appears to be very ...
author: Steve Govedich
comments: The Hubba Hubba tent is extremely easy to set up and it appears to be very well made. Have only used it once but it worked perfectly.

title: Five Stars
author: Trish Busby
comments: Love it...sets up easily. Roomy. Awesome!

title: Floor leaks !!
author: Suvrangshu Ghosh
comments: I purchased Hubba Hubba by reading great reviews and paid the extra dollars thinking that I will have a quality product. but I was wrong !!!Failed in very basic area - rainfall !!I went for a backpack in this Memorial 2016 weekend and it rained for a couple of hours. Inside the tent everything was dry, but then I saw puddle of water at the floor . I had footprint, the footprint did a great job in keeping the area dry. The water got trapped between the footprint and tent floor and leaked in. Without a footprint I would have been soaked wet in freezing mountain weather. Very disappointing. Sharing some pictures. Now i have to figure a way.space wise it has good space and very light and easy to setup

title: Great 3 season tent.
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Great lightweight tent really breathable perfect for summer. I'm currently cycling across Canada with it and the extra space is great. Not sure how well it would survive in high winds though.

title: Five Stars
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Everythink is ok. Congratulations.

title: Awesome tent! Very light compared other backpacking tents
author: Daniel
comments: Awesome tent! Very light compared other backpacking tents. It isn't "ultralight" (2-3lbs) but it is light (4-6lbs). But for the price it is perfect. Did not feel like paying 50% more for the ultralight gear which is usually only for serious long term backpackers (months at a time) that need to compact their bags to under 20lbs. The material is light and yet strong. Easy to put up! I have got it down to 2.5 minutes up and about 5 minutes down (folding and what not). The alternate configurations really help when raining. Wind resistant and rain resistant. Always dry inside except for some condensation but opening a slight opening at top of door helps that issue. The fly and tent have good separation and the tent has awesome ventilation, especially without the fly! Couldn't be happier and would argue this might be the best tent as far as quality vs price goes on the market.Something to note: the poles are straight before you put it up the first time. But after that the poles will slightly keep their bend. This is normal and verified via MSR. They will replace if there is a significant issue with the poles bending though as they always stand behind their products.

title: My favorite piece of gear!!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: This is by far my best gear purchase to date and to be honest my favorite piece of camping equipment. I've taken this baby to quite a few places around Texas, Colorado, Utah, and California and it still makes me smile every time I begin to unpack it. This tent is great for backpacking or car camping as it is very lightweight and durable(Been through Rain, Wind, and Snow). The setup is pretty much a no brainer which can be assembled or disassembled in a matter of minutes. I was surprised at how small it packs down yet how sturdy and spacious it is once put together. It comfortably sleeps two people with enough room in each Vestibule for my 45L or 75L packs with room for my shoes. I've had this tent for just under a year and know that it will last me for many more years to come. I would have no hesitation buying this again or recommending to friends.

title: You get what you pay for.
author: Gianni D'Alerta
comments: Fast setup, great construction. You get what you pay for.

title: Great tent design, but did not come with advertised MSR GroundHog stakes...
author: Reilly
comments: Excellent lightweight backpacking tent. Spacious construction and durable design. Unfortunately my tent order came without the advertised GroundHog stakes though, so I suppose I may have been required to order them separately.... That was the only disappointment however.

title: 2 years of researching I totally recommend this tent!
author: Global Traveler
comments: I purchased this from REI because I had a coupon, which made it cheaper.  But, regardless where you buy it this tent is awesome!  I didn't take it in the field until about 10 months after I purchased it. I first set it up indoors and it was pretty much self-explanatory. Very very simple. The only thing I kept getting wrong is putting the rain fly on inside out :D I camped in the fall and it was in the 40s and I stayed pretty comfortable, but I used summer weight sleeping sack and blanket and should have used a winter one. I LOVE the vestibule! I put fold-up compact toilet in one and my backpack in the other. I camped solo and had lots of room to spread out my stuff, like wipes, clothing, toiletries, snacks etc.  I car camped and felt very comfortable inside and it was very windy at times but the tent stayed stable since I did use the guy lines. The only thing, and believe this is minor, but the "ONLY " thing they can do to improve this tent is design it somehow so when you're inside you can adjust the two side vents. Those vents came in handy when it got a little warm, you can feel the breeze and I'm sure if it was really hot outside those vents would mandatory and many tents don't even have those. So, a small modification to adjust it from inside would be marvelous so I wouldn't have to get out of my comfortable position to go outside.  Also, I like how bright the interior is since the rain fly is white. Puts you in a better mood if you're spending time inside in the daytime. I made my own footprint from one those SOL orange emergency blankets, but I plan to make one from tyvek later. If you're looking for an oversized 1 man tent with lots of arm, leg and head room and room for ALL your stuff this is the only tent I would recommend. 5 Stars!

title: Great tent for two
author: Jim Fitch
comments: I love this tent.  Not super light, but for a two person, it's still light enough to throw on the backpack.  Easy to set up once you've done it a couple times.

title: Easy, light and AWESOME.
author: Sarah gillman
comments: Absolutely fantastic. Having two vestibules is life changing. My husband and I LOVED this tent instantly. We are serious backpackers.Roomy, easy setup, simple design, effective and lightweight especially considering the size! I recomend watching some of the youtube videos about this tent if you are shopping around. I am SO glad we bought this tent.

title: MSR Hubba Hubba Gets an "A+"!
author: Rasferret
comments: This was a Christmas present for my daughter who wore out my Mountain Hardwear tent (bought by me in 1994). Actually, I just wanted my tent back...But when this arrived in the mail I was sure there were parts missing since it was so small and light; but, no! She immediately set it up in the living room without looking at the instructions and I'd guess it took her 5-8 minutes. All with a yellow lab trying to get inside at every opportunity.She obviously has hasn't had any "real world" experience using it yet but I examined the construction and it is amazingly well done. Very roomy and the roof height allowed even my 6'3" frame to have a lot of space in all areas of the tent.Double doors on both sides is a huge plus.Breakdown was easy and it all fit back in the small package with no issues!You guys knocked it out of the park with the MSR Hubba Hubba!

title: Yes!
author: Amazon Customer
comments: Haven t tried in heavy rains yet, but the product is amazing and I m very happy so far.

title: Five Stars
author: LessBoringOne
comments: Very good design and light weighted. Need test its robustness..

title: Five Stars
author: ice man
comments: nice!

title: A must have tent for backpacking in the back country.
author: IGHALL
comments: Love this tent light weight and very strong tent. MSR makes the very best outdoor gear.

title: Very happy! A great one man tent with plenty of ...
author: JohnSAS
comments: Very happy! A great one man tent with plenty of room to move around and sit up in, or two man tent.Can be used with just tent, just fly rain screen ( great for beach shade) or together for a great system.I use my with just the mesh tent and a Kelty Tarp over the top

title: Perfect for Philmont!
author: Matthew Willings
comments: Awesome tent that exceeded my expectations!  Perfect for my next trip to Philmont Scout Ranch.

title: ... assembled it when it arrived and found it very easy. this tent is very compact and light
author: Hunter19
comments: So far I have not used it in the field but I assembled it when it arrived and found it very easy. this tent is very compact and light, I was impressed by this. I will update upon my return from my Wyoming backcountry trip.

title: This thing rocks
author: jsjjdf
comments: This tent is AMAZING! I use for one and two person applications, fits in the pack easily, sets up super quick, and superb quality and engineering is apparent in every detail. Buy this tent once for $400, or buy other tents many times for less.

title: Light, Durable, Quality 2-Person Tent.
author: Ryan Ward
comments: My wife and I (and our dog) love to backpack and over the last year have been switching over to ultralight equipment. I spent quite a while researching different two person tents and finally settled on the Hubba Hubba NX. I was looking for a tent that had enough room for the two of us, was plenty light, but also didn't sacrifice quality/durability for weight, and I think the Hubba Hubba NX is the right call for us.I am 6'2", my wife is 5'3", and our dog is a 45lb lab/border collie mix. Our packs are each around 20-25lbs. We fit perfectly in the tent and our dog sleeps in one side of the vestibule while our packs are in the other.This tent is made of really high quality materials, which can be seen everywhere from the silNylon that it uses for the body/fly down to the all metal tabs on the tent body/fly that the poles lock into. The tent is also perfectly symmetrical, which makes for easy setup. One thing we noticed during our last trip that was a really nice feature is that if you have the tent door open, but not tied back, it doesn't hit the ground - a small, but appreciated detail.Overall, I couldn't ask for a better two person tent. Light, durable, quality.

title: MSR did it again
author: Trisha G.
comments: Its really a 1.5 person tent.  Lightweight, plenty of room for one person and their gear.  Easy to put up, good air flow.

title: terrific tent. light, flexible in design, airy, and rain-proof
author: Eric F
comments: I had the original MSR Hubba (1 person tent), and with a family I wanted something a bit bigger. I've had myself and my 5 year old daughter in here, as well as myself (5'10", 190lb), my 5 year old (42"), and my 2 year old (~34"). All three of us, mats sort of overlapping a bit, side by side, with some gear the bottom, all just fine.The vestibules are decently wide. You can actually pitch this tent "dry" by putting the rain fly up first (into the footprint), then putting the tent underneath the rain fly (since it clips to the now-erect frame). The only catch to point out is that you need to take it down the same way. Whatever order you put it up in you need to break it down the same.My biggest love for this is that I can have one tent that works for me as a fairly weight conscious backpacker. It's super spacious for one person, but still pretty light. For two (or three!), it's very light.The only other caveat I'd provide is that you want to make sure you line the vestibules up with the doors. One "end" of the tent has the zippers going up near the top, so that's the best entrance. The rain fly also has a best end to use for an entrance. The catch is that it's relatively easy to cross it up so you end up with the vestibule opening being opposite of the best door access. It's not the tent's fault, it's just something to keep in mind.

title: Light weight Tent with Style
author: trianglechoke
comments: MSR Huba Huba made my girlfriend huba huba in the back country... It's a very nice tent...it's a little more sensitive because it's light weight, but we really enjoyed our time in this tent, as it's very cozy, kinda romantic..First night we used this, I pitched it in a storm in Capitol Reef Utah, thank god I practiced in my living room as I was able to pitch the fly first and the rest of the tent under its protection for the rest of the mesh & body.  A nice feature of this tent. I also purchased the footprint, a very nice addition as it protects the floor a little better incase something pushes through.  But I hear the tent is fine without it.  I like the footprint cause I can go lightweight & leave the body w/mesh at home for a ultra lighter weight tent. A neighboring dog ripped our mesh the next day, but I contacted MSR when we got home, they made recommendations of repair, using their patches (not included, I wish they were) I sent it back for repair.  MSR has the best customer service ever.  Theyre fast & awesome, they also fixed another problem with the tent, but it was a fluke with the fly coating, they replace the mesh & fly free,.Best service ever.

title: Outstanding
author: Josh Aldy
comments: I've only been out a few times in this tent so far, so I can't speak to its durability other than that the material seems really solid and my current expectation is that this tent will last a long, long time.  That being said, this thing is a drastic improvement over other tents I've camped with.  There is no other tent I know of that provides so much interior room with such little weight at such low a cost.  If pack weight and tent interior size are factors that are important to you, look no further.  I'm 6" and I can stretch out with my arms above my head, and I can sit up with plenty of clearance to spare.  The two vestibules provide an enormous amount of easy access storage which has been a really nice feature.  I researched tents exhaustively before settling on this one, and I have yet to experience any second thoughts.  This is a really well designed tent, and if and when I need to replace it, I'll buy another one without shopping around for anything else.

title: Maybe the best piece of gear I've purchased.
author: b77
comments: Fantastic! I bought this tent to hike the Teton Crest Trail. It performed flawlessly, even in multiple days of rain.Set up is quick and easy for one person. I bought the two person size to accommodate my wife on future trips. But even this size is suitably light for a single person trip. I have also used the tent on overnight canoe trips in humid south Mississippi. Even set in wet sand next to a river, there's never a drop of moisture in the tent. The venting and airflow are just that good.The free standing nature of the tent also lends itself to living room 'camping' with the kids, if you so choose to trust them in your nice tent. My wife and I will be taking this one to Colorado next month and I expect nothing but flawless performance again. We are considering the gear shed to go along with it.Prior to the above mentioned Teton trip, my buddy and I set up tents together to test. He returned his $700 tent after watching me work with the Hubba Hubba. I really don't think there's a better tent for the money.

title: comfortable and it seems sturdy tent
author: Sergey
comments: Really light, comfortable and it seems sturdy tent. It would be nice if the distance between the earth and outer tent was smaller, so the wind would be less blew the tent. Thank you!

title: Good so far
author: Tm
comments: Great product so far,  a little pricey so durability will determine long lasting impression,  first msr product with no warranty interactions so hesitant on a full 5 star rating,  if you're a bigger person who needs room to hibernate at night,  the size and length on interior are great for this tent

title: One of the absolute top tent choices out there! ...
author: Jason kuntz
comments: One of the absolute top tent choices out there! This tent is very lightweight, requires very little pack space, and is durable enough to last!

title: Fantastic.
author: Khachik
comments: I don't know why i neglected to leave a review for this tent. I was leaving a review on another product and decided to leave one here as well.The tent is just great!!! Well worth the price. The quality of the materials used is incredible, and of course the weight of it is outstanding. As a filmmaker, it is very important what you carry and how much it weights.I definitely recommend this to any backpacker.

title: Five Stars
author: Angel
comments: Super light tent , perfect finishes , the only drawback is that it has a high price .

title: MSR knocked the ball out of the park with this design!
author: R. Harbert
comments: Wow!  All I can say is this tent is awesome!The quality of this tent is amazing!  I've been through several tents looking for one I felt would hold up to any weather but is still light enough for a single back packer to carry comfortably!  The way the poles connect to the foot print, tent and rain fly is very secure with none of those little plastic clips other brands have!It is extremely easy and fast to set up!I did a lot of research on this tent and I am extremely happy with this purchase!My dog and I back pack and the 2 person tent is just the right size!  He's a black lab and he gets most of the room!  lol

title: best tent
author: adamsko
comments: An amazing tent.  It is extremely light, easy to set up, and very versatile (footprint required).  I live in Hawaii so this tent is perfect.  When I go camping I take the whole kit tent, fly, and footprint.  But when I hit the beach I take the fly and footprint and have a nice shaded area for me to get out of the sun if necessary.  This is a very spacious tent.  I can put two large sleeping pads and still have some space by your feet.This tent can be adjusted so many ways.  I could talk all day about this tent.  But it is just better to watch YouTube videos and you will get the picture.

title: great
author: Jerrod Begora
comments: I've been searching for a new tent for a while.  This tent is big enough to two people and light enough for 1 person to take on a tour.  love it!!!!!!!!!!!!.  I officially have used it in rain and toured with it 130 miles on a bike.  Love it.

title: bigger, smaller and lighter
author: Bridge
comments: great tent that packs down very small, lots of room for yoga inside and great durable fabric with colour coding for setup...only thing is i didn't realise it didn't come with a footbed...

title: Excellent
author: Charles E. Irvin
comments: I'm planning on hiking the Pacific Crest Trail from the Mexican border to Canada.  The first few hundred miles are mostly rocky, and I wanted a true, free standing tent because I don't plan on carrying a hammer to pound stakes in.  Although it's probably wise to stake the corners, this tent is truly free standing, even with the rain fly on.  It was very tight putting it up the first time, so I left it up for a week in the house to let the fabric relax.  It comes with a good stuff sack and the poles can be strapped independently to your pack.
